alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 05 at 2:03PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Warm temperatures have caused ice movement across parts of the Kuskokwim Basin. This has resulted in swiftly moving ice jams and flooding of nearby areas from ice action. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...Including the following area, Kuskokwim Delta, specifically the region around Oscarville Slough and Napaskiak. * WHEN...Until 200 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 154 PM AKST, emergency management reported an ice jam on Oscarville Slough near the advisory area. Impounding water due to the ice jam will cause rapid river rises upstream. - Cooler temperatures later in the week should allow streams in the area to start to re-freeze and water levels to drop. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along Oscarville Slough or nearby stay alert and be prepared to take action. - The cold water temperatures can increase the threat of hypothermia and lower the time required to cause hypothermia.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
